item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S10382)

summary.text:
Hurricane Katrina Reconstruction and Displaced Worker Assistance Act of 2005 - Directs the heads of federal executive agencies, in entering into contracts to procure services in connection with Hurricane Katrina reconstruction efforts, to give a preference in the source selection process to each offeror that employs workers displaced by Hurricane Katrina as at least 25 percent of the workforce that will perform such services.

Reinstates the application of the prevailing wage requirements of the Davis-Bacon Act to all federal contracts in connection with Hurricane Katrina reconstruction efforts in the localities involved, notwithstanding the President's proclamation dated September 8, 2005, or any other provision of law.

bill.title: Hurricane Katrina Reconstruction and Displaced Worker Assistance Act of 2005

item.title: Hurricane Katrina Reconstruction and Displaced Worker Assistance Act of 2005
A bill to promote the employment of workers displaced by Hurricane Katrina in connection with Hurricane Katrina reconstruction efforts.
Hurricane Katrina Reconstruction and Displaced Worker Assistance Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
